name: The Equinox Golf Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we just got back from our ski trip and this place was the best and worth the drive to Stratton mountain.Excellent service and the rooms are very modern. Nice pool, steam room and sauna. The hotel was packed. we made our reservation a month in advance. They had a wedding and it was also during US open. Restaurant was expensive (but steaks were the best!) Nice atmosphere at the bar (they had live band). People were sitting by the fire place while waitig to be called to the dining room. It was very romantic:-)
reviews.title: really a charming place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just came back from a weekend at the Equinox. We absolutely loved it. We arrived Friday night and went to have dinner at Bistro Henry--excellent meal. We then got a couple drinks at the Falcon Bar at the hotel. Really cute bar with some live acoustic music. We got up on Saturday and went skiing at Bromley which is about 10 minutes from the resort. Stratton is just a few minutes further. We then had dinner at the Reluctant Panther which is located next door. We had an amazing meal and a great waiter. On Sunday, we did the Land Rover Experience at the resort. We went on our tour with our guide, Rick who was very knowledgeable and friendly. It was a really neat experience for my husband and I and we would recommend it to others looking for something different to do. We also did some outlet shopping. There are some really great stores such as Theory, Kate Spade, J Crew, Giorgio Armani, etc and the shopping is only a couple minutes away. All and all, the service was top-notch and the hotel is beautiful. The remodeled rooms are very nice. We didn't think the beds were that comfortable and the down comforters seemed a little small (one of us was always cold). Small glitch in our trip, but otherwise fabulous. We hope to return in the summer for some fly fishing and falconry. Also, be sure to try the apple-cider donuts in the gift shop!
reviews.title: Wonderful Service; Beautiful Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is an beautiful and luxurious hotel--but is still great for families. We loved the spa and fitness center. They also have an indoor pool and indoor tennis. We were not there for skiing, but Bromley and Stratton are nearby. Our only complaint is that our rooms were in a noisy spot very close to the main lobby. Otherwise, the rooms are very European and lovely.
reviews.title: Beautiful and full of charm.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: My family and I stayed at the Equinox over February vacation. The hotel was amazing and the pool was great for the kids. We stayed on my starwoods points and we were given an upgraded room at check-in. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We only ate at the restaurant one of the nights. I thought the food was good and the price was reasonable (especially the kids menu). The hotel had a kids movie playing each night and also converted one of the conference rooms into an arcade with several video games. They have a great hill behind the hotel for sledding and the hotel provides sleds free of charge.
reviews.title: Perfect spot for school vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also took our kids (6 & 9) for snowboard lessons at Bromley Mt. and they had a blast. It wasn't cheap but well worth the money in my opinion.
reviews.title: Loved the Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Equinox is a nice historic inn located in Manchester Village. It's situated on beautiful grounds with excellent views of the beautiful green mountains. The rooms have been redecorated in a modern style, with browns and blues as the central color hues. There is a spa on the property and the sauna, pool and steam room are of free use to all of the Inn's guests. Although there are plenty of places to eat within Manchester, the pub is worth a visit for a drink and maybe a nibble or two off the delicious, but very filling cheese plate. The service in the hotel is good - all the staff are pleasant and helpful. My only complaint is that we were placed in a room two floors above the air conditioning unit which could still be heard from the 2nd floor. We had originally been placed on the first floor and were moved to the 2nd after we complained. The hotel should look into finding a quieter air conditioning unit. Still, it wasn't such a distraction that it had an impact on the pleasure of our stay. If you are going to Manchester, the Equinox is the place to stay. You'll find good service, nice rooms, and excellent views of the beautiful mountains.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay in Manchester Village

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Charles Orvis Inn at the Equinox from a Sunday to a Friday. As many other reviews state hear. The hotel and inns are old and lack any soundproofing, so you can hear every creak and sound made in the hotel. Since we did not stay during the usual weekend stay (Friday - Sunday), we mostly had the Charles Orvis Inn to ourselves. BUT, the Orvis Inn is next to the service road for the main Equinox hotel, so every morning around 6am we were woken up by delivery trucks to the hotel. Also the room we stayed in on the 3rd floor to the rear was also next to the delivery area for the Orvis Inn. Anytime anyone ordered room service or if there was a meeting in the Inn, a squeaky cart would be rolled along the cobblestones and wake us up as well. The room was clean and newly renovated. Housekeeping was excellent although the hotel has cut down on amenities like toilet paper, shampoo, soap, etc. Even towels were one per customer.
reviews.title: Beautiful Manchester but So So Equinox

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The buffet breakfast priced at $23.50 each (while expensive) was very good. A nice selection of continental breakfast as well as eggs, waffles and pancakes made to order. Breakfast was in the Colonnade room which was bright and sunny and overlooked Equinox mountain.
reviews.title: the ultimate in relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: For lunch we tried the Marsh Tavern and were disappointed two days in a row. The food was overcooked even a day or two old I might say. Skip it for sure. You can find much better places to eat in and around town and at a much better price.
reviews.title: "It's just an old creaky house."

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also both had Swedish massages at the Spa. They were good. But the Spa was nothing special. For a five diamond resort they could do better.
reviews.title: Not what it tries to be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I arrived at the Equinox expecting great thinks and was, overall, sorely disappointed.
reviews.title: Great location, beautiful hotel - hugely disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While customer service was impeccable and the grounds beautiful, the hotel rooms were surprisingly poor (especially given the much-advertised recent update).
reviews.title: Elegance & Luxury in Manchester VT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To start, our room was very small. This in and of itself was not so much of a problem, other than that it was also horribly designed. The room completely lacked a mirror (except for the bathroom half-mirror). There was no desk or table. The bed, advertised as a queen, certainly didn't look/feel like one. As for storage, there was an armoire, not a closet.
reviews.title: Great stay, will be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I called the front desk to inquire why amenities that I received at Hampton Inns or Four Points, where I stayed for $100/night, were unavailable at this location only to be told that this is the basic ('superior' [sic]) room setup. I can't see how anyone would spend >$400/night (or 10,000+ points/night) to stay in a room without a desk or mirror - does no one ever do work here? or check how they look before events?
reviews.title: Lovely Vermont property.....but expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Other annoyances, but for which I did not deduct any stars (they are to be expected for a property of this age, so I give them as fyi-only) include complete lack of soundproofing (we awoke to kids singing in the hallways at 7am) and uneven doorframes. Also, we were not fans of the cheap-feeling armoires, whose drawers were hard to open because the door hit against the TV table.
reviews.title: I didn't want to leave!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from The Equinox so I'm writing this with everything fresh in my mind. First I would like to say I agree with much of what the reviewer from Concord MA had to say about this place. We liked it, it's a beautiful property. The location couldn't be more picturesque with the mountain view in back and the proximity to shopping, dining, etc. The staff was very friendly, check in was no problem on a busy weekend. We had a large room (king bed) on the first floor overlooking the center "backyard" of the hotel. The bathroom was also very large with ample vanity space. Both rooms were clean and the bath well stocked with plenty of towels. We were right near the SPA building and there are several entrance/exit doors so access to other areas of the property is easy. The SPA is fantastic. If you stay here and don't take advantage of any services here, you are wasting your stay. At the hotel, The Marsh Tavern was nice (we just had drinks here) and breakfast in the Colonnade Room was good, nothing spectacular, but a great selection. The building is OLD so we heard voices, slamming doors and heavy footsteps from the floor above but it wasn't to the point of annoying. I can appreciate historic buildings and you have to expect those things before you book a place like this so I have no problem with that.
reviews.title: Great place but overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, even at peak season I would expect that for upwards of $450 a night plus a $25 "property fee" I would get a super plush bed like the fabulous W Hotels heavenly beds with down pillows, down comforter and luxuriously soft sheets. The bed was a king but nothing better than what you would get at a Red Roof Inn. And the furniture was somewhat of a strange decor mix of 1985 Miami meets 1905 San Francisco. Also our room did not have a refrigerator or coffee maker. While these are not necessities, they are convenient. As others have mentioned, a re-do of the rooms is coming so hopefully they will improve on the rooms without hiking the rates.
reviews.title: Timing was right

likes.liked: — I felt like I was at home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, we had a good experience but the room rate didn't quite meet the cost.
reviews.title: Staff Professional, Rooms Not Worth the Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Equinox Resort ownership changed in Spring 07, and the same owners recently (August) acquired the 1811 House. I booked prior to the sale, but received a letter a few weeks ago informing me that I could take advantage of all the Equinox amenities while paying the same price I booked at. This was a pleasant surprise (amenities include a free shuttle service, a lower greens fee which includes club storage, usage of pool, New York Times, etc.). Be aware that new bookings will include a resort fee of $25/day; and I was told that room rates are also being "evaluated." There is also talk of moving the wonderful daily breakfast served in the charming 1811 dining room (or pub if one chooses to eat there) to the Equinox. This may only be a seasonal change since high season is nearing an end. Be forewarned that major work is upcoming at the Equinox which is a hop, skip and jump from 1811. I would be very careful before booking at either place so I knew what I was getting into (will you be traipsing down the street for breakfast???).
reviews.title: Brilliant last minute find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Now, as far as the 1811 House, it is a wonderful old home which has been very well maintained. We stayed in the Grace Hoyt Singer room 4 nights and the Robert Todd Lincoln room 1 night. The Singer room for the price ($210 high season) is a jewel once you get settled in (little room to empty suitcases). It is cozy, quiet, overlooks the town green, old church and Equinox. The recently renovated bath with one window is a delight! The small tub/shower is big enough to bathe in if one wishes. There is a towel heater, several fans and heaters, blow dryer, magnifier mirror, vanity with two drawers, etc. The bedroom features a window, a small plasma tv (behind the mirror panel), and queen canopy bed with comfortable bedding. The RTL room for $260 was not worth the $50 upcharge unless one wants a fireplace and a bit more space. Two nice windows in the bedroom but none in the dark bathroom which could use some updating (low sink, exhaust fan that comes on with light, etc.). The main drawback is its locale right at the front of the home fronting busy 7A/Main Street. It was unseasonably warm so we had to leave the windows open, and it was quite noisy. The Isham room is across the hall and would have the same noise problem.
reviews.title: You'll love next door

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the Equinox Resort was certainly lovely, they were not ".. rooms you’ll be delighted to retire to after a long day.." The drunken, raucous noise of the bar and the heating system unit rumbling in the room next to us left me with the first night sleepless. (no, we did not run our unit that first night because of the ridiculously loud fan and my husband slept only because he had been up for 48 hours flying home from international business and was wiped out!!!) Just to be able to get to sleep Night 2, we were forced to run the fan on the wildly noisy, archaic heating unit just to drown out the wild bar noise from a wedding party one floor below and again, the incessant, rumbling hum of the heating unit in the guest room next to us. DO NOT let them put you in a room near the stairways. And too bad they didn't use some of the millions to update the heating/air system.....
reviews.title: Multi-Million Dollar renovation????

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from an after Thanksgiving 3 day getaway (Sunday-Tuesday) with my wife. We have stayed at the Equinox before and fell in love with its charm. Upon arrival, the staff greeted us with warm smiles even after 3 days of Thanksgiving craziness to a packed hotel. The place was empty and quiet. The room was facing the courtyard with a very comfortable king bed and marble bathroom. We had 7 widows facing out and with the curtains open the view was lovely. We wanted to go out to dinner in town one night and when we asked for our valet parked car to be brought around the young lady at the front desk offered the hotel SUV to shuttle us back and forth at no charge, which was very nice and extremely convenient. After dinner we sat outside by the lit fire pit with hot chocolate laced with Baileys Irish Cream from the bar. It was so peaceful with the dark mountains behind the hotel and the warmth of the fire and outdoor heaters that were lit. The hotel may not be small but it is rich in history and a perfect location. The spa is wonderful, with its pool, exercise room, steam rooms and saunas. I even broke down and got a relaxing massage.
reviews.title: Relaxing Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The only downside, and I don't think it can be helped, is that the walls are very thin. Some of the rooms are set back from the hallway in a small alcove entrance which muffles some of the sounds of people in the hallway or children screaming. Our room entrance was in the hallway and we did hear those sounds. Probably not so bad since the hotel was empty, but if crowded it could be a problem.
reviews.title: Hotel Ambassadors

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: All in all a great stay, we left more relaxed then when we arrived and that is the ultimate goal of any getaway. We will be back, and we will make sure that it is off peak again.
reviews.title: Classic New England Getaway with Great Food and Activities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Upon entering this grand hotel I was warmly greeted by the front desk staff. They were very welcoming and made me feel that they were gald that I was there. Everywhere I went I was verbally greeted by staff who were always smiling. They seemed happy to be at the Equinox too!! The staff were willing to do anything to insure that I have the very best stay!!
reviews.title: Great Thanksgiving getaway for the entire family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful property in great town and ideal setting for weekend with family, but limited nu,ber of suites FYI
reviews.title: Great with kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have just returned from our annual visit to the Equinox. Had yet another wonderful stay. Stayed in The Orvis Inn and the room was perfect as always. Dinner at the Marsh Tavern was again delicious and the staff there top-notch. Angela in reservations went above-and-beyond to make our trip there this year possible when we ran into a last-minute complication. We so appreciate her extra effort! Pool and spa were enjoyable - a highlight of our visit each December!
reviews.title: Another wonderful stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed here 2x as a platinum member, once a couple of years ago and more recently 3 days from Dec 18 - 21st, both times on points - don't expect a suite upgrade as I have never received one here due t their limited availability(apparently). The resort is romantic (even with the noise), The Spa is fantastic, make full use of the gym, steam and sauna even if you don't book a treatment (it is all included in the annoying $25 resort fee which is mandatory whether you use everything or not), take a hike up the hill to the pond from the back of the hotel - you can go from an hour to as long as you like, make sure to try out the great restaurants in town - Silver fork is new and outstanding but only has 6 tables so make a reservation (it is fine dining but very reasonable), Reluctant Panther is also a great bet but more expensive. The Chop house in the hotel has great steaks but it is over priced. Make sure you check out the bookstore in town and grab a coffee/breakfast or lunch in the great cafe attached. Tip, to cut down on noise from kids running in the hall and slamming doors, ask for a quiet room if possible and if not, pack the extra pillows around the base of your door to shut the huge gap..it helps. Enjoy.
reviews.title: Noisy - lots of kids, but still a great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Had a very good two night stay at the resort. Very friendly staff all the way from check in to wait staff. Rooms looked a little dated but were nice and welcoming. Staff genuinely cared about their guests. Breakfast buffet had a lot of variety and was priced right for the resort.
reviews.title: Relaxing Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall an excellent experience. Will certainly revisit when the opportunity presents itself.
reviews.title: Glad I wasn't paying!
Great Location and Improved Service- Updated Rooms Apparently on the Way
reviews.text: Our third stay in three years. Here is our summary of the Great, The Better, The Bad and Progress Coming. We rated it above average for the dining, the staff, the views and the pool. Below average for rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Great
reviews.title: Appalling room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is convenient to Boston (our home) and with two young children it is a great place to stay- close to family friendly ski slopes (Bromley and Stratton in the Winter) and the pool (indoor - out door) is super. The view of the Equinox Mountain is spectacular, especially in the evening. The Marsh Tavern and the elegant main dining room are beautiful and the food is superb.
reviews.title: Nice but too expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Better
reviews.title: 1811 House

likes.disliked: — Mattress quality and Maid carelessness in locking the room after preparing it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our stay in September 2006 was almost our last- with rude front desk service and disorganization in the dining rooms being the main reasons for our disappointment. After reading of the sell of the property by RockResorts we decided to give it another go. We were pleasantly suprised right from the start with the check in service much better and pleasant than before. Bellmen are among the best I have seen. They were gracious when we requested a room change (for a better view). Jerry out front is great- and the dining staff in the Marsh Tavern made our family most welcome. The service in both dining rooms has improved three to four levels.
reviews.title: Say No to the TOWNHOUSES!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am usually the type that likes a country B&B, but we took advantage of our Starwood points to reserve a last minute room for Memorial Day weekend at the Equinox, which went under a 10 mil renovation two years ago, I gather when they became a Starwoods hotel. Everything was wonderful, still has the old world charm, but I loved the resort feel and we walked everywhere. We particularly enjoyed the Falcon Bar at the hotel, a must do to sit on the deck and enjoy their cheese plate with cocktails. We didnt get a room with a view, bathroom is small but adequate, i like that the sink is outside the toilet, and the King bed was wonderful like new, great tv, it was perfect for our quick getaway. Everyone went out of there way to please us, cant say enough good things about our stay. Highly recommend
reviews.title: WOW

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The service at the Equinox is among the best - staff is friendly and helpful and have great suggestions regarding things to do around town. The food at the Marsh Tavern is quite good, spa treatments are excellent and fairly priced, the gym is well-appointed and the rooms are surprisingly spacious. Our only complaint was the air-conditioning in the bedroom - very loud. We also did the Land Rover driving course, which was a lot of fun. Overall a great experience and we would definitely return.
reviews.title: Great service and amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves at the resort. It did come as a surprise that it was situated along the curb of one of the main thoroughfares as the pictures gave us the impression of seclusion. We also did not expect that some activities would be across the street or a short drive away...but nothing is far. The grounds were very well maintained and the staff could not have been more hospitable. For example, the electricity went out throughout the area in the early morning of our last day. The staff apologized multiple times and quickly set up a delicious and varied continental breakfast buffet free of charge for their guests. Even though the property was being repaired from the long winter, they took every care to make it a pleasant and relaxing stay.
reviews.title: Beautiful Surroundings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This facilities are outstanding and the location is wonderful. The new renovations have been well done. The indoor pool and outside deck is very well maintained and relaxing. The outside Pit Bar is a delight. Staff is excellent and goes above and beyond to address you properly and accommodate your requests.
reviews.title: Elegant Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The three (3) negatives we found were 1) no coffee maker in your room. They do have coffee in the morning in the Falcon Bar area; 2) there are no comfortable seating chairs in the room; and 3) the lighting over the dressing area sink is very dark and so is the separate make-up mirror.
reviews.title: amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here as part of a New England tour that was self-planned via the internet. The resort is fabulous, with a stunning setting and we had fabulous weather which helped too. The spa was lovely, and we sat in the hot-tub one night to watch the sunset on a clear, cold evening which was very memorable. Overall, though the room was a little tired although spacious and comfortable enough, and it was honestly just too pricey. At $369 per night it was a bit too steep, then the levying of a dubious $25 per day 'resort fee' was just taking a rise out of customers. I would say $300 per night would be closer to the true value, and ditch the fee and win more customers hearts!
reviews.title: Great, but not perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I have stayed at the Equinox twice in the last two years. Its a lovely
reviews.title: A relaxing treat nestled between the mountains and the outlets.

likes.disliked: — 8:30 am maid service knock on first morning. Easily fixed with PRIVACY PLEASE sign next day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: old hotel. The rooms are very clean at least the two that I have had. The bathroom is large, but lacks alot of counter area. Furnished blowdryer a nice touch.
reviews.title: Mixed bag at the Equinox

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is very friendly. Every time I walked past a cleaning person
reviews.title: Decent hotel & spa. but our room was awful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: they said good morning.
reviews.title: disappointment after disappointment

likes.liked: — disappointing after going their for past 10 years
likes.disliked: — rudeness of staff, room were old and unkept for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Nice hotel but the noise was over the top... I did not expect this hotel to be soundproof because of the age of the hotel... but I did not expect it to be the level of noise it was. Lovely hotel in every other respect... but the noise ruined the whole experience for me.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but the noise was over the top

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Food was nice
reviews.title: Beautiful New England Charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Staff was nice
reviews.title: A WONDERFUL RESORT...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Spa Director was GREAT
reviews.title: Best of the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: -Gym could be larger since this is a "resort"
reviews.title: Family stay at The Equinox Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay , the associates couldn't have been nicer, Eryn with a warm welcome after our long drive, Check in fabulous, Jennifer made sure our friends were across the hall, Stacy from housekeeping had us set up perfectly for the week , the team could not do enough for us. The rooms were very comfortable and charming. Evenings spent by the fire with games available for us to play. The week was very relaxing and we experienced outsatnding service by Kim in the Marsh tavern, she understood children and made our daughter feel very special. We had a wonderful week and highly recommend
reviews.title: New England Charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed at this property over Thanksgiving. Beautiful property, brimming with old New England Charm. The property is newly renovated and very comfortable to stay in. It is an old establishment, therefore have limited amenities (ex., our deluxe room, an upgrade from standard ... does not have a tub). For our purposes, we were fine without a tub but it is rather basic given it is marketed as a 'luxurious' destination.
reviews.title: Beautiful property, missing on basic service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Prior to arrival, we received a personal email from the hotel confirming our stay, mentioning what they cannot provide (e.g., Suites unavailable -- which is fine) and confirming others that they can (e.g., microwave needed for our infant's feeding). I thought this was a very nice touch.
reviews.title: Great accomodation, too many uncontrolled kids.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Personnel were all friendly - room service, valet, front desk, concierge, etc. Room service was very prompt, the food was not great. Very friendly staff but that said there were glaring instances which I would consider incompetence. Some instances:
reviews.title: Another Wonderful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011
reviews.text: - At check in, I asked if our room had a view. The response "we have no suites available" (plus diatribe). I said I got the email and fine if we don't have a suite, I was curious to know if we had a view of the mountains or the parking lot. The response "we have no suites available". At this point, I addressed the clerk by his first name and said "I DO NOT need a suite but what do we see out the window?". Finally, he said "Trees ... but it is because you requested for a quiet room". For the record, I had no specific request for a quiet room -- perhaps that was their decision since we informed them we have a baby with us. Net of it, I was fine with whatever room they had but it was rather annoying to deal with somebody who cannot even listen!!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were very excited about visiting this "classic" and for the most part were not let down. Rooms are very dated, but from what we were told a renovation is on the way. Staff was generally friendly and the rate was pretty good. Food in the outlets was absolutely fabulous. We asked to speak with the chef and a nice young man (Tyler I believe) came out to talk to us. We complimented him on the food and he let us know he was very new and had a lot of changes in store. Quite excited about this. Spa experience was fabulous. All in all little bit dated but after the renovation this will be the Ritz Carlton Vermont.
reviews.title: Pretty good time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: One of my pet peeves is desk clerks who try to make you think you are being upgraded when, in fact, it's quite the opposite. This was the case at the Equinox. Jerry, our porter, gave us an exceptionally warm and friendly welcome, but one star to the woman at the desk who explained we had been assigned from our original room to a "nicer " one! Not the case. Next to the elevator does NOT constitute a quiet location. Location DOES make a difference when staying at an old hotel. I would NOT recommend accepting rooms 108-140. Nearly every other guest in the hotel will have to walk by your room to get to theirs or the elevator, and it's very noisey! Even on a higher floor, we could hear the people on all sides of us much more clearly than was comfortable. If there are children in any adjacent room, immediately ask for a room change if you wish for a peaceful stay. The room was ordinary in size, but it was very clean with the necessary ammenities. The townhouses are larger with kitchens, but NO ambience. I saw no evidence of the dirty, run-down facility another reviewer mentioned. Everything was exceptionally well-cared for especially the grounds. No, the mirror ISN'T in the bathroom which means it doesn't fog up and allows the user privacy from someone using the water closet! This is, in my opinion, a good thing. This is not a hotel for city folk who want all the bells and whistles. It's old; it has charm, ambience, history, and some of the problems that are associated with an older hotel. There are lots of restaurants in the area, and I would recommend trying them. Food at Equinox did not impress. High-end outlet shopping is great, and the golf course is beautiful. There are some great experiences available such as the falconry school or Land Rover adventure, and there are many wonderful photo opportunities for shutterbugs. I probably would stay elsewhere if I returned to Manchester as I think there are better values, but this hotel would fit well on a Vermont postcard if that's want you are looking for.
reviews.title: Location DOES matter

likes.disliked: — lack of insulation (noise from adjoining rooms and hallway)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading the reviews but still wanting to try and stay we had a completely different experience then most and even thou I do always check these reviews, it proofs sometimes you need to experience things for yourself and you might experience something completing different.
reviews.title: Pleasently Surprised
Disgraceful!!!
reviews.text: We arrived on Mother's day and were greeted with smiles and some joking from the front desk staff including Alyson. The bell man Claudio brought our bags to our roon, offered to take us on a tour and was a wealth of information. Our room was very pleasant and well decorated with a view out the back to the grounds.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not do much due to my husband not feeling well but when we did venture out, Claudio had informed us there was a shuttle and so after dinner we called for a ride back and was promptly picked up, even thou we were only about 2-3 blocks from the resort.
reviews.title: A little better than Average BUT could be much better!

likes.liked: — The fireplace and coffee/tea/hot chocoalte area

description: Resting under the shadow of Vermont's Green Mountains on 1,300 acres in the quaint village of Manchester, The Equinox, A Luxury Collection Golf Resort & Spa awaits your discovery.
